intro: Anadelphia bigeniculata, commonly known as the two-winged false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-winged fruits. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white to pinkish flowers. It is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wetlands. Anadelphia bigeniculata is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
